column1: Sobinka (Russian: Со́бинка) is a town and the administrative center of Sobinsky District in Vladimir Oblast
column3: located on the right bank of the Klyazma River (Oka's tributary)
column5: the administrative center of the oblast. Population: 19

column1: It was called Komavangard (Комавангард) for a short period in the 1920s. It was granted town status in 1939.
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Sobinka serves as the administrative center of Sobinsky District
column3: to which it is directly subordinated. As a municipal division
column4: the town of Sobinka is incorporated within Sobinsky Municipal District as Sobinka Urban Settlement.
